data.title: Amazing Po Boy Oyster Sandwich!
data.text: Ate here several times and drank many beers! Love this place. It is right across the street from the Marriott on the corner.

data.title: Hidden gem, you will love it
data.text: An absolute hidden gem in downtown Charlotte!!! My husband and I went here, because we were too exhausted to leave our hotel for the evening, after a long day. It truly was amazing and I'd even rate it up there with many of the 5 star restaurants we have been to, throughout the east coast. Everything, and I mean everything, that we ordered was cooked superbly. Everything tasted fresh and was cooked perfectly to order (not sitting in a hot well all night waiting to be served).  We were delighted with a small taste of filet, topped with a dill aioli and micro greens, that the chef sent out as a welcome. It totally sold us on ordering the 7oz filet as our entrees. For starters we ordered the crab cake and the seafood starter trio. Being from the Eastern Shore, I am very critical about crab cakes, but this one did not disappoint! Full of lump and hardly any filler. The seafood trio was also to die for! it came with a butternut squash "cappuccino", which was basically a butternut squash creme brûlée (AHHHMAZING), a perfectly seared diver scallop (AHHHMAZING), and the lobster cobbler (a delicious creamy lobster filling in a puff pasty cup -yes AHHHMAZING). My husband ordered the Cesar salad - it came with shaved Parmesan and a perfectly cooked egg, to break the yolk over the salad.  They have an extensive wine list. We opted for a Malbec, which was also delicious. My husband and I both ordered the filet, medium rare, topped with ribeye butter....you guessed it, AHHHMAZING!! Both steaks had a nice hot crust on the outside and perfectly cooked warm on the inside. As sides we ordered the asparagus, steak mushrooms, goat cheese grits, and mashed potatoes....all were hot, full of flavor, and delicious! To end our meal we had to order the Krispy Kreme bread pudding (topped with a Makers Mark caramel bourbon sauce and creme anglaise).  All of the other reviews on here said it was outstanding, so I had to try it for myself.  No words can describe this sinfully delicious dessert. No words......seriously the best tasting dessert I've had in a very long time. More people should check this hotel restaurant out, you will definitely not be disappointed.

data.title: 50th Birthday Dinner... WONDERFUL!
data.text:
Had no idea where we were going to go for dinner to celebrate a milestone birthday, a bit surprised when we pulled up to the downtown Marriott.  BEST MEAL EVER!  

Very small restaurant (only about 7 tables) so you for sure feel as if you are in an intimate setting, highlighted by the rich red colors of the walls and the gorgeous red glass light/artwork in the middle of the room and the lovely 3D artwork on the walls.  

The service was excellent and attentive without being overbearing or always constant.  Very pleasant.  While my husband must have alerted them to the birthday, I felt they went over the top to make sure I felt special..from the champagne for all of us compliments of the chef, to the flaming Krispy Kreme bread pudding soaked in Makers Mark brought to us for dessert to recognize the event.  

The rest of the meal was really fabulous as well.  From the chef's muse of a fabulous beef skewer to the raspberry palate cleanser and the then the appetizer: lobster cobbler with saffron ice cream.. to the entrée ..pork tenderloin with roaster root vegetables and German dumplings... every single bit was exquisite!  

Never would have thought that a restaurant within a hotel could be so refined and delicious but it was... I would not hesitate to go back and would recommend to anyone!

data.title: Traditional dining @ its finest!
data.text:
Amuse buche?! Palate cleanser?! Personalized attention?! Yes! These and others still exist in the Queen City!  

My wife and enjoyed one of the best meals ever. 
I started with the Lobster Cobbler. It was served with a side of Saffron Ice Cream to provide coolness to the warm lobster as an option. It definitely wasn't for the "sweet-savory" thing as the lobster was sweet. Nice touch!
My wife had the Pimento Cheese with Smoked Endive salad and it was inspiring. The cracked black pepper on the smoked endive was a nice touch that balanced the naturally anise taste.

For our main my wife had the Jumbo “New South” Shrimp and Grits. It included 3 very tender and quite large scallops. Overall it was ok, but the grits were a bit undercooked and not as creamy as we'd liked.
My main was the Tea Brined Pork Chops. It was cooked to medium and spot-on. The "Popcorn Grits" were a pleasant surprise, and quite inventive.

Our waitress, Mariha (sp?), was so nice and attentive that I really felt as though I was at one of the Relais and Chateaux restaurants.

TIP: Parking is validated so either self-park or valet.

data.title: Dined here twice and loved it
data.text: Great personal service in a small dining area which makes it very nice.  You don't have the huge dining area so you feel like you are on a VIP list or something.  Personal service with a smile each time.  Menu was diverse with several new entrees.  Loved all three courses.  Wine selection was adequate as well.

data.title: Smaller, but quaint restaurant
data.text: A group of friends and I tried this venue for Charlotte Restaurant Week. Although we ate off of a smaller menu, I made sure to try the tried and true Krispy Kreme Bread Pudding - it definitely lives up the the hype! It comes out on FIRE on a square plate, and is delectable and sweet! The restaurant itself is small - so not the best venue for a party of five or more, especially if you don't have reservations in advance. The decor is romantic and swank, and wait staff is generally attentive. The food did take some time to come out, but it IS a restaurant in a hotel, so they are probably taking care of hotel guests AND restaurant. Overall, I would probably go back again, especially for dessert!

data.title: Almost there
data.text:
Note, we dined there with a group, had a dedicated menu rather than ordering from the normal offerings.  Service was superb - attentive yet not overbearing.  Food was very good, but the quirky occasionally threatened to overcome the adventure.  Fried oyster and small cup of gumbo as appetizers were superb; poached egg swimming in bacon consomme was very good but needed tools to handle the addition to it of a crisp stalk of asparagus tempura (needing knife, fork and spoon for a soup course seemed a bit cumbersome).  "Southern Nicoise" consisted of charred sardine, Scotch quail egg, pole beans, olive powder, potato foam, candied tomato vinaigrette - that definitely got the quirky award - but the sardines (both mine and my wife's) had numerous bones which weren't of the chewable sort, and the necessity to pick bones out of a sardine, which also tasted a bit oily-fishier than I'd have preferred, was both off-putting and made me wonder about who'd thought through the menu.  Red Snapper Cassoulet was very good, and the flight of veal was outstanding, with the sweet breads astoundingly good.  "French toast" dessert was a chocolate pot de creme and was also very good and was accompanied by a coffee bean brittle that was unexpected as a dish and delicious as well.  

All that said, a fine dinner, just not quite a 5-star.

data.title: Nothing Special
data.text: Went to Savannah Red recently during Restaurant Week  with some foodie friends after hearing the rave reviews. My experience was not in the category of "exceptional" it was actually far from it. The positive is the beautiful decor and light fixtures. The menu is limited, the service was so so and my steak and two asparagus spears were served cold. The wait staff did offer to send it back but I declined fearing it would take a long time. The Krispy Kreme bourbon bread pudding dessert is over the top and heavy on the bourbon sauce. If you are in uptown walk a block and half or so south on Tryon St and go to the Mimosa Grill instead of Savannah Red, the food, service and ambience are consistently superb at Mimosa Grill.

owner_response.author: Charlotte M, Manager at Savannah Red, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I would like to sincerely apologize for  your unfortunate dining experience. There is no acceptable excuse for delivering cold food or giving bad service.  Our restaurant prides itself on giving our customers a memorable experience and it upsets all of us to hear of a disgruntled guest.
Savannah Red changes their menus seasonally and we do tastings prior to introducing our new menu in the restaurant.  I would like to invite you to be a participant in our next menu tasting as I believe your restaurant experience would be invaluable to us.
If you are interested, please contact me: gary.oikemus@marriott.com and thank you again for sharing your experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fully and completely average
data.text:
I don't understand all the five stars and the one one star review. There's nothing terrible about this place. But, there is nothing great about it either.

The restaurant is a small room off the bar off the lobby. Kind of a cool room, but it was pretty empty so not much of a vibe to it.

The menu rid great. Some of the dishes sounded really interesting. But, none of them were as good as they sounded. Each dish seemed like separate components on a plate. They lacked cohesion and a unifying element.

data.title: Southern Gem with new Flare!
data.text: A hidden treasure hiding in plain sight!! if this wasn't located in the Marriott lobby people would be raving about  it. The creativity is only outdone by the delivery and flavor. Go if you want some of the best new south food, don't go if you are a snob who won't go to a restaurant in a  Marriott no matter how good it is!!

data.title: Nice atmosphere, Good food and service
data.text: This is my new favorite restaurant in Uptown Charlotte.  I'm strictly Vegan and the Chef prepared a special meal for me.  I'm used to just putting "sides" together, so this was a real treat.  Both my husband's an my meals were delicious, and the service is friendly and attentive.  Good wine choices, as well.  The dark red decor is just romantic enough.

user_location.name: Roaring Gap, North Carolina, United States

data.title: Great experience
data.text:
My mother raves about this place, she frequents Charlotte for the theatres and has visited all of the restaurants in the area. 
There was a warmth to the atmosphere and service, which  included the chef who came to our table to describe our specially-requested vegan meal. It was a wonderful experience from the moment we walked in. The walls are a warm red and the light fixtures are fancifully unique and ornate.  
We were served a spicy amuse bouche and my bouche was very amused. The next course was a strawberry sorbet to cleanse our palet before our deliciously amazing entrée.
I live in Boston and have frequented many of the top restaurants there, NYC and elsewhere. Savannah Red is on par, if not surpassing them, distinguished by their warm, personal service which made the meal that much more enjoyable.  
(Top chefs have left good reviews here, they can be trusted. The lower reviews must have the place confused with the attached breakfast place, which was good, but not as distinguished as Savannah Red.)

data.title: Just average
data.text: A small, perhaps 15 table, restaurant in the Marriott Hotel. The ambiance was at best ho-hum. The service was very attentive but the meals were not memorable. The red velvet cake dessert was very dry.

data.title: A great hidden gem
data.text: Gourmet Soul Food? I love it. Who would have thought such a nice little gem would be hidden inside the Charlotte Marriott. We had some very artistic chefs with us since we were all here for the Research Chefs Association's annual conference. No pressure to the chef since we didn't say anything until half way through the meals. They started us out with a complimentary smoked salmon torte. Some great appetizers, then a blood orange sorbet for palate cleansing. It was quite a culinary experience. The head chef came out since he was also a Johnson & Wales alum as were our guests. Great score and I highly recommend.

data.title: Consistently great service and food
data.text:
Once again we visited the Savannah Red in Charlotte.  I've almost always ordered the Filet, and it was fantastic as ever.  My husband had the Seafood Special and it was excellent as well.  We shared the Trio Sampler as an appetizer, and you just can't beat the sauces.

We spent our first hour at the wine bar, chatting with two great servers:  Eva and Maria.  The service was exceptional!  We couldn't have had a better meal.

data.title: Rubbish--Avoid
data.text:
This restaurant is nothing more than the Marriott hotel breakfast place with red wall carpets and the lights dimmed...so it is kind of a scam when you think about it! Small and uncomfortable tables with a strange floor layout.  There are literally dozens of top notch authentic eateries within short walking distance, so there is no need to suffer through this.

Food is average to terrible, about what you'd expect from a hotel restaurant. What is even worse are the very high prices, which make this a very poor value.

(I simply am at a loss to explain other reviewers who rated this place highly...perhaps they just didn't venture out of the hotel door and so didn't have a basis to compare?  No idea really, but they are wrong. Or the hotel is having employees right positive reviews and post them. This place is most certainly NOT one of the top restaurants in Charlotte as claimed by one reviewer. In fact, it is one of the very worst restaraurants in Charlotte, especially considering the inflated prices and phony decor transition from breakfast)

data.title: Great food and great service
data.text: We had a great meal at this restaurant!  One can only guess about the time and attention it must of taken to prepare the great meals we had.  Further, the service was excellent.  The restaurant was only half full when we were there (we came very early on a low night) and yet we got very attentive service.  Usually, servers usually disappear for long periods of time when they have a low load (probably because of fewer tips per hour and less chance of turning a table).  But none of that here!  The attention to detail, all details, was amazing.

data.title: The old South newly presented
data.text: In the downtown Marrriott, the restaurant advertised "new Southern cooking."  But the meal was entirely different than anything I had eaten in the South.  Beginning with the lump crab bisque, topped with a creamy Sunflower-root mix, followed by a seafood skillet of lobster, crab, and whitefish smothered in a very lite cheese sauce.  I ordered a side of the chef's special grits instead of garlic potatoes, and got a smooth mixture that perfectly balanced the fish entree.  The hostess and waitress made me feel like I had returned home and treated me like a king,

data.title: One of the best
data.text: This is by far one of the top restaurants in Charlotte.  It is easily accessible, the restuarant is small and very intimate.  The menu is excellent and the the food is amazing.

data.title: One very very wonderful evening
data.text:
I was in charlotte for business and had evening reservations near the end of the night. The experience was some
 of the finest dning I've ever had. I felt like I arrived as a customer but left as a friend. My very highest compliment to Eva our server. Knowlegable, kind and attentive. And special mention to the Restaurant Manager Ty..I would travel to Charlotte and have dinner there just to enjoy the company of these very fine people.
